description: Web-like structures formed by neutrophils that trap pathogens and are associated with inflammation.
A chronic inflammatory bowel disease causing inflammation in the digestive tract.
A type of inflammatory bowel disease that can affect any part of the gastrointestinal tract.
A treatment that inhibits the activity of tumor necrosis factor-alpha, used for inflammatory conditions.
Proteins involved in signaling pathways that regulate various cellular processes including inflammation.
A pro-inflammatory cytokine involved in the inflammatory response.
A chemical used to induce colitis in animal models for research purposes.
